result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sermonte Dazion Ashford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sermonte Dazion Ashford not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court for Sermonte Dazion Ashford.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on State's Motion to Joinder with Defendant's other case 22CF1082.  Motion hearing held.  Court hears argument. Court places findings on the record.  For reasons as set forth, Court GRANTS State's motion. As to Defense's motion for confidential informant, Defense informed the Court Motion has been Withdrawn. Court also heard arguments as to Defenses motion for further testing. Court DENIED Defense's motion. Parties selected Final PreTrial and Jury Trial Dates. Court ordered any motions filed by December 14, 2022. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Reserve Branch.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Brief in Response to State's Motion for Joinder; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Letter from the court to counsel - uploaded to the case and forwarded to counsel on today's date

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Sermonte Dazion Ashford not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court for Sermonte Dazion Ashford.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Parties discuss with the court, issues regarding previously filed motions. Crime lab needs more time for testing. For reasons stated on the record, court orders case adjourned for ruling on motion to compel discovery, motion for continuance, and motion for joinder with regard to case #19CF4409 and co-def case #19CF4410. Court ordered that any documents needing to be filed should be filed no later than 10/21.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-13, this case has been reassigned to Judge Franke.
Received and Filed: Attorney Andrew Gawronski

Adjustment Number: 22A 068504,
Payable Number: 1021198,
Receipt Number: 22RP029411,
Amount: $20.00
Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for a Status Conference on 09/28/2022 at 11:00 am, Br 16.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (14 pages) commencing April 1, 2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.
Received and Filed. State's Joinder Motion.pdf

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Sermonte Dazion Ashford not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Case called following defendants pending felony matter. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Sermonte Dazion Ashford in court with Attorney Douglas E. Batt; both appear by video.  Defendant Sermonte Dazion Ashford in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 16CF4309. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Bryan Wade - Wauwatosa Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sermonte Dazion Ashford in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Sermonte Dazion Ashford in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sermonte Dazion Ashford appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
